name: DSE English Writing - Argumentative Essay
subject: English
instructions: This rubric is used to assess argumentative essays in the Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education (HKDSE) English Language examination. Evaluate across three dimensions: Content, Organization, and Language.

levels.descriptor: Fully addresses the task with well-developed, relevant ideas. Arguments are compelling and well-supported with appropriate evidence and examples.
Addresses the task with mostly relevant ideas. Arguments are generally well-developed with adequate support.
Partially addresses the task with some relevant ideas. Arguments may lack full development or supporting evidence.
Limited response to the task. Ideas may be off-topic or insufficiently developed.
Fails to address the task. Content is irrelevant or severely limited.
Coherent and well-organized with clear paragraphing. Logical progression of ideas with effective use of cohesive devices.
Generally organized with adequate paragraphing. Good use of cohesive devices with minor lapses.
Some organization evident. Paragraphing may be inconsistent. Limited range of cohesive devices.
Limited organization. Weak paragraphing with minimal use of cohesive devices.
No clear organization. Absence of paragraphing and cohesion.
Wide range of vocabulary and grammatical structures with minimal errors. Precise and effective word choice. Demonstrates sophistication in language use.
Good range of vocabulary and structures with occasional errors that do not impede communication.
Adequate vocabulary and structures with noticeable errors. Meaning is generally clear despite errors.
Limited vocabulary and structures with frequent errors that sometimes impede communication.
Very limited language that severely impedes communication. Errors are pervasive.

commonErrors: Weak thesis statement that does not clearly state the argument
Lack of topic sentences in body paragraphs
Informal language or contractions in formal writing
